001package squidpony.squidgrid.mapping;
002
003import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.DungeonBoneGen;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.styled.TilesetType;
005import squidpony.squidmath.CellularAutomaton;
006import squidpony.squidmath.GWTRNG;
007import squidpony.squidmath.GreasedRegion;
008import squidpony.squidmath.IRNG;
009
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011
012/**
013 * An IDungeonGenerator that distorts and smooths an ordinary dungeon map to make it appear like a cave complex.
014 * This usually exhibits the complex connectivity that dungeons made with a {@link TilesetType} like
015 * {@link TilesetType#DEFAULT_DUNGEON} have, but shouldn't have noticeable room/corridor areas, and should appear as
016 * all one cave.
017 * <br>
018 * An example map this can produce:
019 * <br>
020 * <pre>
021 * {@code
022 *   ┌─────┐ ┌───────┬─┐ ┌───┐                ┌────┐   ┌────┐   ┌────┐    ┌──┐                  ┌───┐   ┌─────┐
023 *  ┌┘.....└─┘.......│.└─┘...└─┐    ┌─┐    ┌──┘....│   │....└──┬┘....└┬───┘..└──┐  ┌───┐       ┌┘...│  ┌┘.....└┐
024 *  │..........................└┐ ┌─┘.└┐   │.......└┐  │.......│......│.........└─┬┘...│  ┌───┬┘....│  │.......│
025 *  └┐.........┌┐...............└─┘....└┐ ┌┘........│ ┌┘....│.....................│...─┤┌─┘...│.....│  │.......│
026 *   │........┌┘│.......................└─┘.........└┐│.....│.....┌┐...................││...........│  │.......│
027 *   │........│┌┘...............................#....││.....│.....│└┐..................└┘...........│  │.......└┐
028 *   │.......┌┼┘.....┌┐............┌─┐..............┌┘│.....├─┐...│ │...............................│  │........│
029 *   │......┌┘│....┌─┘└┐.........┌─┘ └──────┐.......│ │....┌┘ │...└─┤......#.......│................│  └┐.......│
030 *   │.....┌┘ └┐.┌─┘   └┐.......┌┘          │......┌┘ │...┌┘  └─┐...│....│........┌┤........│.......│  ┌┘......┌┘
031 *   └┐...─┤   └─┘      │......─┤  ┌──┐     │......│  │...│    ┌┘.......─┘.......┌┘└─┐....─┬┤.......└┐ │.......│
032 *   ┌┘....└┐  ┌─┐  ┌───┘.......└──┘..└┐    └┐.....│ ┌┘...└┐ ┌─┘.................│  ┌┘.....│└┐.......└─┘.......└┐
033 *  ┌┘......└──┘.└┐┌┘......─┐..........└─┐  ┌┘.....└─┘.....│┌┘...................│ ┌┘......│ │..................│
034 * ┌┘.............└┘........│............└┬─┘..│...........└┘.....│.........───..└┬┘.......│ │....┌┐............│
035 * │........................│......┌─┐....│....├┐...............──┘...............│........└─┘....│└┐...........│
036 * │...┌─┐........................┌┘ └┐.......┌┘└┐................................................│ └┐..........│
037 * │..┌┘ └┐.....................┌─┘  ┌┘.......│  │...............................................┌┘  │..........│
038 * └──┘   └┐...................┌┘   ┌┘........│  └─┐...│...─┐...........│........................│   └┐.........│
039 *         │..................┌┘    │.........│ ┌─┐└───┴┐...│...........├─┐........│.............└─┐  │.........│
040 *     ┌─┐ └──┐.....┌──┐......│    ┌┘...┌───┐.└─┘.└┐    └┐..├┐..........│ └┐......┌┤...............│  └─┐.......│
041 *     │.└─┐  └┐...┌┘  └┐.....└┐   │....│  ┌┘......└┐    │..│└───┐.....┌┘  └┐....┌┘├─.....┌──┐.....│    │......┌┘
042 *     │...└┐  └┐..│   ┌┘......└─┬─┘...─┤  │........└┐ ┌─┘.─┤    │.....│    │....│ │......└┐ └┐....│    └┐....─┤
043 *     └┐...│  ┌┘..│   │.........│......│ ┌┘.........└─┘....└─┐ ┌┘.....│   ┌┘....├─┘.......└┐ │....│     │.....│
044 *      └┐..│ ┌┘...│   │................│┌┘...................│ │......└───┘.....│..........│ │....└─┐   │...┌─┘
045 *       │..├─┘...─┤  ┌┘................├┘....................└─┘................│..........└┬┘......└─┐┌┘...│
046 *       ├─.│......│ ┌┘..<........│...#.│...........................┌┬─......................│.........└┘...┌┘
047 *       │..│......│┌┘............│................................─┴┘......................................│
048 *      ┌┘......┌──┘│....................┌─┐.....................................┌┐.........................│
049 *      │....┌──┘   └─┐..................│ └─┐.┌─┐....┌─┐....┌─┐.........┌─┐.....│└─┐......┌─┐....┌──┐......│
050 *      │...┌┘        └─┐...........┌────┘   └─┘┌┴─┬──┘ └────┘ │........┌┘ │....┌┘  │.....┌┘ └────┘  └──┐...│
051 *      │..┌┘           └┐.....┌─┐..└┐          │..│   ┌──┐    └┐......┌┘ ┌┘....└┐  └┐....│    ┌────┐   │...└┐
052 *     ┌┘..└┐ ┌─────┐   ┌┘....┌┘ └┐..└┐        ┌┘..│ ┌─┘..└─┐   └┐.....│  │......└───┘....└┐  ┌┘....└┐  └┐...│
053 *    ┌┘....└─┘.....└┐ ┌┘.....└┐ ┌┘...└┐       │...│┌┘......│    │.....│  └┐..........#....│ ┌┘......└┐  │...│
054 *   ┌┘..........│...└┬┘.......└┐│.....└─┐   ┌─┘...││.......├─┐  │.....│   │...............└─┘........└┐ └┐..└┐
055 *  ┌┘.......┌───┴┐...│.........││.......│  ┌┘....┌┘│.......│.└──┼┬─...│  ┌┘...........................└┐ │...│
056 * ┌┘.......┌┘    │.............└┘.......└┐ │...┌─┘ │...│.#......└┘....│ ┌┘........................│....└─┴─..└┐
057 * │........│    ┌┘.......................│ │..┌┘   └┐..│..............└─┘......──.................│...........│
058 * │........│   ┌┘..........┌─┐..........┌┘ │..│     └┐.............................┌─┐........................└┐
059 * │........│  ┌┘.....┌─────┘ └──┐.......│  │..│      │.........................┌───┘ ├─...┌────┐...............│
060 * │........│  │.....┌┘          └┐.....┌┘  └┐.└┐     └┐......┌─┬─┐....┌──┐.....│    ┌┘...┌┘    │....┌─┐........│
061 * └┐......┌┘  │.....│    ┌────┐  │.....│   ┌┘..└┐     └┐....┌┘┌┘.│....│  └┐....│   ┌┘....│     │....│ │........│
062 *  │....┌─┘   │.....└┐ ┌─┘....│  └┐...─┤  ┌┘....│      └┐...└┬┘.......│   │....└┐ ┌┘.....│  ┌──┘....└┬┘........│
063 *  │....└─┐   └┐.....└─┘......└┐  │....└──┘.....└─┐  ┌─┬┘....│........└┐ ┌┘.....└┐│......└──┘........│.........│
064 *  └┐.....└┐ ┌─┴─..............│ ┌┘...............└──┘.│...............│┌┘.......└┘......................┌┐....│
065 *   │......└─┘.................└┐│.....................................└┘...............................─┤└┐...│
066 *  ┌┘.........│.................└┘.........................│................┌──┐.#.#.....................│ └┐.┌┘
067 *  │..........│..........................................──┼──┐.....#......┌┘  │....................│....└┐ ├─┤
068 *  └┐.........│.....................┌─┐....................│  └─┐..........│   └─┐................#.├─┐...└─┘.└┐
069 *   │....┌┐.........┌─┐.........│..┌┘ └─┐..................│    │...┌───┐..└┐    │..................│ │........│
070 *   └┐...│└─┐.....┌─┘ └┐......┌─┴┐.└┐   └─┐..........│.....│    │...└┐  └┐..└─┐  └─┐....┌──┐.......┌┘ └┐.......│
071 *   ┌┘..┌┘  └┐...┌┘    └┐.....│  │..│ ┌─┐ └┐.......┌─┤....┌┘    └┐...└─┬─┘....└─┐  └┐...└┐ └┐......│   │......┌┘
072 *   │...│    │...└───┐  │.....└┐┌┘..│┌┘.└┐ └┐.....┌┘ │....│      ├─....│........│   └┐...└┐ └┐.....└┐ ┌┘......│
073 *  ┌┘..┌┘   ┌┘.......│  │......└┘...││...└┐ │.....└┐┌┘....└┐┌────┘.........┌─┐..└┐   └┐...└┐ └┐.....└─┘.......└┐
074 * ┌┘..┌┘    │........│  └┐..........└┘....└─┘......└┘......└┘..............│ └┐..└┐   │....│ ┌┘................│
075 * │...│    ┌┘....┌───┘   └┐...............................................─┤  └┐..└┐  └┐...└─┤.................│
076 * │..┌┘   ┌┘....┌┘        │..........................................┌┐....│   │...└┐  │.....│.................│
077 * │.┌┘   ┌┘.....└┐        │..........................................│└─┐.┌┘  ┌┘....└─┐│.......................│
078 * │.└┐  ┌┘.......└───┐   ┌┘.......┌┐......┌─┐..................│.....│  └─┘   │.......└┘.....>.........#.......│
079 * │..└┬─┘............│┌──┘......┌─┘└┐.....│ └┐..─┐.............│.....│        │.............┌─┐...............┌┘
080 * │...│..┌──┐........││........┌┘   └┐...┌┘  └┐..├───┐..............┌┘        │..┌─┐......┌─┘ ├─....┌┐........│
081 * │......│  └┐......┌┘└┐......┌┘     └───┘    └──┘   └┐....┌──┐....┌┘       ┌─┴─┬┘ │.....┌┘   │....┌┘└┐......┌┘
082 * └─┐....│   ├─.....└┐ │......└┐     ┌──┐             │....│  └┐..┌┘       ┌┘...└┐ │.....│   ┌┘....│  └┐.....│
083 *   ├─..┌┘  ┌┘.......│ └┐......└┐   ┌┘..│             └┐...│   └──┘       ┌┘.....└─┘.....└─┐┌┘.....└┐  │.....│
084 * ┌─┘...└┐ ┌┘........└┐ │.......└───┘...│              │..┌┘              │................└┘.......│  └┐....└─┐
085 * │......└─┘..........│ └─┐.............└─┬───┐       ┌┘.┌┘               │.........................└┐ ┌┘......│
086 * │...................└┐  └───┐...........│...└───────┘..└┐               │.......┌─┐................│ │.......│
087 * └┐...................│      │..........┌┴┐..............└┐              ├─......│ └┐...............└─┘.......│
088 *  └┐.#................│      │..........│ └┐..............└┐         ┌───┘.....┌─┘  │.........................│
089 *   └┐...............┌─┘      │.........┌┘  └┐.....┌───┐....│         │.........│    │......│....┌──────┐.....┌┘
090 *    └┐.┌───┐........│        └───┐....┌┘    └─┐.┌─┘   └─┐.┌┘         └┐......┌─┘    └─┐...┌┴────┘      └─┐..┌┘
091 *     └─┘   └────────┘            └────┘       └─┘       └─┘           └──────┘        └───┘              └──┘
092 * }
093 * </pre>
094 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 8/18/2017.
095 */
096public class FlowingCaveGenerator implements IDungeonGenerator {
097    public DungeonBoneGen gen;
098    public final int width;
099    public final int height;
100    public TilesetType type;
101    public IRNG rng;
102    public final int[][] environment;
103    private boolean remakeEnvironment = true;
104    protected CellularAutomaton ca;
105
106    /**
107     * Default constructor that makes a 60x60 cave map with a random seed.
108     */
109    public FlowingCaveGenerator()
110    {
111        this(60, 60);
112    }
113
114    /**
115     * Makes a cave map with the specified dimensions and a random seed.
116     * @param width the width of the dungeon map(s) to generate
117     * @param height the height of the dungeon map(s) to generate
118     */
119    public FlowingCaveGenerator(int width, int height) {
120        this.width = Math.max(3, width);
121        this.height = Math.max(3, height);
122        type = TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON;
123        rng = new GWTRNG();
124        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(rng);
125        ca = new CellularAutomaton(this.width, this.height);
126        environment = new int[this.width][this.height];
127    }
128
129    /**
130     *
131     * @param width the width of the dungeon map(s) to generate
132     * @param height the height of the dungeon map(s) to generate
133     * @param type a TilesetType enum value; {@link TilesetType#DEFAULT_DUNGEON} is used if null or unspecified
134     * @param rng a random number generator to use when generating the caves; if null this will use a default RNG
135     */
136    public FlowingCaveGenerator(int width, int height, TilesetType type, IRNG rng) {
137        this.width = Math.max(3, width);
138        this.height = Math.max(3, height);
139        this.type = type == null ? TilesetType.DEFAULT_DUNGEON : type;
140        this.rng = rng == null ? new GWTRNG() : rng;
141        gen = new DungeonBoneGen(this.rng);
142        ca = new CellularAutomaton(this.width, this.height);
143        environment = new int[this.width][this.height];
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Generates a flowing cave dungeon withthe same {@link TilesetType} this was made with, or
148     * {@link TilesetType#DEFAULT_DUNGEON} if none was specified. This uses the
149     * convention of '#' representing a wall and '.' representing a bare floor.
150     *
151     * @return a 2D char array representing a cave system with '#' for walls and '.' for floors
152     */
153    @Override
154    public char[][] generate() {
155        return generate(type);
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Generates a flowing cave dungeon with a different {@link TilesetType} than this generator was made with.
160     * The default type is {@link TilesetType#DEFAULT_DUNGEON} if unspecified in the constructor.
161     * @param type a TilesetType enum value
162     * @return a 2D char array for the cave system
163     */
164    public char[][] generate(TilesetType type) {
165        remakeEnvironment = true;
166        gen.generate(type, width, height);
167        ca.remake(gen.region);
168        gen.region.and(ca.runBasicSmoothing()).deteriorate(rng, 0.9);
169        gen.region.and(ca.runBasicSmoothing()).deteriorate(rng, 0.9);
170        ca.current.remake(gen.region.deteriorate(rng, 0.9));
171        gen.region.or(ca.runBasicSmoothing());
172        ca.current.remake(gen.region.removeEdges().largestPart());
173        gen.region.remake(ca.runDiagonalGapCleanup());
174        return gen.region.intoChars(gen.getDungeon(), '.', '#');
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Generates a flowing cave dungeon with a different {@link TilesetType} than this generator was made with, and
179     * specifying a chance to keep the original walls of rooms before the flowing smoothing step is performed.
180     * {@code roomChance} can be between 0.0 and 1.0, and if a room (identified with a similar technique to
181     * {@link RoomFinder}, but not using it directly) is randomly selected to be preserved (the probability per room is
182     * roomChance), then most of its walls will be kept in-place, generally with more right angles than the caves will
183     * have. It may be best to keep roomChance above 0.5 if you want the effect to be noticeable. Starting with
184     * {@link TilesetType#DEFAULT_DUNGEON} is a good choice for {@code type}.
185     * @param type a TilesetType enum value
186     * @param roomChance the chance, from 0.0 to 1.0, to preserve each room, keeping its walls where they start
187     * @return a 2D char array for the cave system
188     */
189    public char[][] generate(TilesetType type, double roomChance) {
190        remakeEnvironment = true;
191        gen.generate(type, width, height);
192        ArrayList<GreasedRegion> rooms = gen.region.copy().retract8way().flood8way(gen.region, 1).split();
193        ca.remake(gen.region);
194        gen.region.and(ca.runBasicSmoothing()).deteriorate(rng, 0.9);
195        gen.region.and(ca.runBasicSmoothing()).deteriorate(rng, 0.9);
196        ca.current.remake(gen.region.deteriorate(rng, 0.9));
197        gen.region.or(ca.runBasicSmoothing());
198        for (int i = 0; i < rooms.size(); i++) {
199            if(rng.nextDouble() < roomChance)
200            {
201                gen.region.andNot(rooms.get(i).fringe8way().deteriorate(rng, 0.81));
202            }
203        }
204        gen.region.remake(gen.region.removeEdges());
205        gen.region.insertSeveral(DungeonUtility.ensurePath(gen.region.intoChars(gen.getDungeon(), '.', '#'), rng, '.', '#'));
206        ca.current.remake(gen.region.largestPart());
207        gen.region.remake(ca.runDiagonalGapCleanup());
208        return gen.region.intoChars(gen.getDungeon(), '.', '#');
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Gets the most recently-produced dungeon as a 2D char array, usually produced by calling {@link #generate()} or
213     * some similar method present in a specific implementation. This normally passes a direct reference and not a copy,
214     * so you can normally modify the returned array to propagate changes back into this IDungeonGenerator.
215     *
216     * @return the most recently-produced dungeon/map as a 2D char array
217     */
218    @Override
219    public char[][] getDungeon() {
220        return gen.getDungeon();
221    }
222
223    /**
224     * Gets an environment map as a 2D int array that {@link SectionDungeonGenerator} can use along with the normal
225     * 2D char array dungeon map to add dungeon features. This marks cells as either {@link DungeonUtility#UNTOUCHED}
226     * (equal to 0), {@link DungeonUtility#CAVE_FLOOR} (equal to 3), or {@link DungeonUtility#CAVE_WALL} (equal to 4).
227     * If the environment has not yet been retrieved since generate() was last called, this assigns the environment map
228     * to match the dungeon map; otherwise it uses the cached environment map.
229     * @return a 2D int array that can be used as an environment map with SectionDungeonGenerator.
230     */
231    public int[][] getEnvironment()
232    {
233        if(remakeEnvironment)
234        {
235            gen.region.writeIntsInto(environment, 3);
236            gen.workingRegion.remake(gen.region).fringe8way().writeIntsInto(environment, 4);
237            remakeEnvironment = false;
238        }
239        return environment;
240    }
241}
